newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks extend losses after lower start.
newsitem.headline: French stocks extend losses after lower start.

text.p: The CAC index pushed deeper into the red after opening lower, continuing Monday's fall on concerns over the euro and France's wrangling on the stability pact, traders said.
"There are no buyers around, there's no support for the market," said a broker. Monday's relatively low volume suggested the unwinding of short positions in the market was over.

The blue-chip CAC-40 index was down 24.44 points, or 0.91 percent, at 2,661.76 at 0815 GMT. The index had opened down 0.56 percent. The CAC-40 futures contract was down 20 at 2,648 from Monday's close.

* Pernod Ricard was a rare riser on the CAC index, gaining 0.45 percent to 293.2. The drinks group last Friday declined to comment on a newspaper report it was set to buy the spirits business of Larios of Spain.

* Renault dropped 2.61 percent to 130.5. The car maker is holding its shareholders meeting today and unions expect a delay in closing the Belgian Vilvoorde factory. Renault declined to comment on the outcome of the meeting.
Renault workers will be leading today's march on Paris with demonstrators calling for a growth and jobs policy for Europe.

* Sommer Allibert outperforms the market, rising 0.09 percent to 215.9. The car parts maker said it is not tendering its shares in Canada's Domco, following a bid from U.S. Armstrong World Industries.

* Eurotunnel continues firming, up 2.29 percent to 6.70, following shareholders attempts to get a better deal in the debt restructuring plan. Small investors group Adacte said on Monday it was recommending a rejection of the debt deal due to significant risks even after any restructuring.
* A Gallup-Merrill Lynch poll showed U.K. funds turned negative on European stocks after the French election.
